readability_reflection: I think string concatenation is more simple and readable in most cases except when having to check for correct spacing. String interpolation is easier to read spacing-wise because it flows like natural reading.
preference_rationale: I personally prefer reading string concatenations even though it can get tedious with spacing. It works well in my brain just adding the strings together back to back.
learning_curve: I think my coding background highly increased my ease of understanding the provided examples. It came more naturally to me compared to someone who doesn't have experience reading code.
suggestions_improvement: I think as a general rule of thumb when using concatentation, you should always leave strings cleanly without spaces at the end and just include a spacer string between concatenations if you need it. Ex: "this" + " " + "boy" versus "this " + "boy"
